HeaderText: This text needed to establish and maintain an appropriate voice to achieve a purpose: to explain, express, reflect or argue.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: Students were invited to create a cohesive text that demonstrated their capacity to explore relevant ideas through purposeful authorial decisions relating to text structure(s), language features and vocabulary.

Subject: English
HeaderText: As with other sections of the paper, the titles provided multiple entry points and potential directions for students to follow.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: The stimulus material was provided to help students generate relevant ideas in relation to the nominated titles.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: There was no preferred VCAA style or content.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: Mentor texts did not need to be referenced.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: Students were free to explore the ideas associated with the title and the Framework of Ideas in any prose style.

Subject: English
HeaderText: As in other sections of the course, students needed to draw on their knowledge of the centrality of context, audience and purpose to successful text creation.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: While students may have created their text for an intended audience (such as like-minded protestors, a young adult reader or a more private self-directed audience), it was important to remember that there was a secondary audience to consider.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: The text formed part of a public examination and could (with student permission) be published on the VCAA website, which has a broad readership.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: The student’s text will also be read, for the purposes of assessment, by an unknown adult.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: As such, students are encouraged to consider the text they create in terms of appropriateness for their intended audience and purpose, as well as this secondary audience and purpose.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: The text’s purpose(s) must be those nominated in the VCE English and English as an Additional Language Study Design.

Subject: English
HeaderContent: Consideration of the implications of these factors should form part of students’ preparation for the exam.
